benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/customFields/search/{searchKey} - Search custom fields

covered: Valid request / happy path: TC01 (path param only) and TC22 verify successful retrieval and JSON-array response.
Pagination: TC02, TC28, TC29, TC07, TC08, TC09 cover limit/offset, paging across pages, boundary and beyond-available behaviour.
Audit levels: TC03, TC04, TC05 and TC28 cover FULL, MINIMAL, NONE and combinations with pagination.
Query-parameter validation: TC10 (ignore unsupported), TC11-TC14 (malformed/negative limit/offset and invalid audit) validate error handling for bad params.
Empty responses: TC06 and TC09 assert empty JSON array is returned when no matching records.
Authorization basics: TC15 and TC16 cover missing and invalid authentication tokens (401).
Error handling for backend failures: TC17 covers service-unavailable (503) behaviour.
Security / input handling: TC18, TC21, TC25, TC26, TC27 exercise special characters, empty/whitespace, very long and Unicode searchKey edge cases.
Performance & concurrency: TC19 and TC20 include stress and concurrent-request scenarios and response-time expectations.
HTTP method handling: TC30 verifies unsupported HTTP method returns 405.
Integration & docs checks: TC23 and TC24 cover integration freshness and error-message/documentation accessibility.
gaps: Caching behaviour and headers: no tests assert Cache-Control / ETag / Last-Modified headers or conditional GET (If-None-Match -> 304).
Rate limiting / throttling: no tests simulate bursts or assert 429 / Retry-After behaviour.
Response header validation: tests do not explicitly assert Content-Type (application/json) or other response headers.
Authorization granularity: missing tests for authorization/permission failures that should return 403 (insufficient privileges), roles or scopes are not exercised.
Internal server errors: no explicit tests asserting handling/format of 500 responses on unexpected failures (DB errors, NPEs).
Missing path param / malformed path: no test for omitted path parameter / invalid URL (e.g., /search/ with no key) to validate 4xx behaviour (404/400).

Schema-level validation: responses are asserted to be "CustomField objects" but there are no strict schema/field-level assertions (required fields, types, audit fields presence/absence beyond general statements).

Boundary/limit semantics gaps: limit=0 behaviour and explicit server maximum-enforcement behaviour (server-side caps) are not covered; TC07 uses a large limit but does not assert cap semantics or 4xx response when exceeding allowed max.
URL/path encoding edge cases: tests don't cover reserved chars in path (e.g., embedded slashes, % encoding) that can change routing vs. searchKey content.
Content negotiation: Accept header variations and how the API responds to unsupported Accept values are not tested.
Standardized error payloads: tests assert presence of error messages but do not validate a consistent error schema/fields or content type for errors.
recommendations: Add tests that assert response headers (Content-Type: application/json) and validate caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control, Last-Modified). Add conditional GET tests (If-None-Match -> 304) to verify caching behaviour.
Introduce rate-limiting tests: send bursts of requests to ensure the system throttles correctly and returns 429 + Retry-After (or documented behaviour) when limits exceeded.
Add authorization/permission tests that exercise role/privilege differences and expect 403 when a valid token lacks required rights.
Add server-failure tests that simulate DB or internal errors to verify 500 responses follow the API error contract and content-type expectations.
Add path/URL encoding tests: include searchKey values with slashes, percent-encoded characters and verify correct routing and search behaviour.
Add strict schema validation tests for returned CustomField objects (required properties and types), including explicit checks that audit fields appear/are omitted according to audit param.

Clarify ambiguous business rules (the spec allows 200 or 400 in several cases). Decide on a deterministic behaviour for empty/whitespace/special/very-long searchKey and update tests to assert the chosen behaviour.
Add boundary tests for limit=0 and for server-enforced maximum limits: verify whether the server caps the limit, returns an error, or truncates results, and assert the expected behaviour.
Add content-negotiation tests (Accept header variations) and verify error responses always return the documented content-type and error schema.
Add standardized error-schema assertions across all error scenarios (400/401/403/404/429/500/503) so error payloads are consistent and machine-parseable.
Automate and surface these additional tests in CI (contract/schema tests, rate-limiting and caching tests) and add performance SLAs to make TC19/TC20 pass/fail deterministically.
